summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-third Avenue Northwest, in the City of Seattle, from West Seventieth Street to West Seventy-fifth Street, by constructing water mains therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all crosses, tees, and other appurtenances necessary for the proper water service of said street, in accordance with Resolution No. 1049 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
